meanings.definition: Not able to be disciplined or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The wild horse was truly indisciplinable, refusing to obey any commands.
meanings.sent2: The unruly child was so indisciplinable that even timeouts had no effect on their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy proved to be indisciplinable, always finding a way to escape from its pen.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an indisciplinable whirlwind, impossible to contain or direct.
meanings.sent5: The storm outside was indisciplinable, with the wind howling and rain pouring relentlessly.

meanings.definition: Not capable of being trained or managed.
meanings.sent1: The feral cat was indisciplinable, refusing to come inside no matter how much food was offered.
meanings.sent2: The stubborn old mule was truly indisciplinable, resisting all attempts to lead it.
meanings.sent3: The misbehaving robot seemed indisciplinable, constantly malfunctioning despite numerous repairs.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was like an indisciplinable tangle, impossible to comb through without pain.
meanings.sent5: The river, swollen from the rain, was indisciplinable, overflowing its banks and flooding the fields.
